name: Errantry
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.

editions.flavor:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone Knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

"There is no shame in solitude. The lone knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

"There is no shame in solitude. The lone knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Erratic Explosion
text: Choose target creature or player. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Erratic Explosion deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that creature or player. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Erratic Mutation
text: Choose target creature. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. That creature gets +X/-X until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. Put all cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Erratic Portal
text: {1}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor: "In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"
"In Barrin's name!" cried Lyna as Hanna's sword passed through her, "Ertai sends word that the portal is open—but not for long!"

name: Error
text: Counter target multicolored spell.

name: Ersatz Gnomes
text:
{T}: Target spell becomes colorless.
{T}: Target permanent becomes colorless until end of turn.

editions.flavor: From jungle to sea, from sea to stone, from stone to field, from field to bone. What am I? —Zhalfirin riddle

name: Ertai
text: Creatures you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: After serving his apprenticeship under Barrin of Tolaria, Ertai graced the Weatherlight crew with his presence as the ship's "resident" wizard. He realizes that few recognize his greatness—but then how could they, when they lack his insight and wisdom?

name: Ertai's Familiar
text:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
When Ertai's Familiar phases out or leaves the battlefield, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
{U}: Until your next upkeep, Ertai's Familiar can't phase out.

name: Ertai's Meddling
text:
X can't be 0.
Target spell's controller exiles it with X delay counters on it.
At the beginning of each of that player's upkeeps, if that card is exiled, remove a delay counter from it. If the card has no delay counters on it, he or she puts it onto the stack as a copy of the original spell.

name: Ertai's Trickery
text: Counter target spell if it was kicked.

editions.flavor: "Don't worry, Gerrard," said Ertai. "I'm sure the crew will come to your rescue as quickly as they came to mine."

name: Ertai, the Corrupted
text: {U}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature or enchantment: Counter target spell.

editions.flavor: Altered by Phyrexian science, corrupted by black mana, and twisted by rage, Ertai still looked in the mirror and saw only glory.
Altered by Phyrexian science, corrupted by black mana, and twisted by rage, Ertai still looked in the mirror and saw only glory.

name: Ertai, Wizard Adept
text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell.

editions.flavor:
"Was that it?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Erupting Dreadwolf
text: Whenever Erupting Dreadwolf attacks, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
". . . heck, I'd settle for anything that even resembled a werewolf."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

name: Escape Artist
text:
Escape Artist can't be blocked.
{U}, Discard a card: Return Escape Artist to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "Not even my shadow knows where I am."

name: Escaped Null
text:
Lifelink
Whenever Escaped Null blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +5/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Left masterless by Kozilek, it wandered the wilds, raving in its ceaseless hunger.

name: Escaped Shapeshifter
text: As long as an opponent controls a creature with flying not named Escaped Shapeshifter, Escaped Shapeshifter has flying. The same is true for first strike, trample, and protection from any color.

name: Escape Routes
text: {2}{U}: Return target white or black creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"I'll get you to safety—or whatever passes for safety these days."
—Urborg ferry pilot

name: Esper Battlemage
text:
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: She can heal the flesh, or exploit its many weaknesses.

name: Esper Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Draw two cards.
• Target player discards two cards.

editions.flavor:
"Thoughts are commodities. Someone will pay a good price for them. Even ones as simplistic as yours . . ."
—Ennor, mentalist

name: Esper Cormorants
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"The smiths of this land must be mad to reach so far and so high for another creature to decorate."
—Cagen Vargan, Jhessian sea scout

name: Esper Panorama
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Esper Panorama: Search your library for a basic Plains, Island, or Swamp card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Esper is an expansive canvas painted by precise, controlling hands.
Esper is an expansive canvas painted by precise, controlling hands.

name: Esper Sojourners
text:
When you cycle Esper Sojourners or it dies, you may tap or untap target permanent.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: The wilder the frontier, the greater the need for a controlling hand.

name: Esper Stormblade
text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Esper Stormblade gets +1/+1 and has flying.

editions.flavor: Stormcallers came to appreciate the novelty of Jund's volcanic updrafts.

name: Esperzoa
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an artifact you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The more metal it digests, the more its jelly will fetch on the alchemists' market.
The more metal it digests, the more its jelly will fetch on the alchemists' market.
The more metal it digests, the more its jelly will fetch on the alchemists' market.

name: Essence Backlash
text: Counter target creature spell. Essence Backlash deals damage equal to that spell's power to its controller.

editions.flavor:
"The other guilds will learn the hard way not to interfere with our investigations."
—Bori Andon, Izzet blastseeker

name: Essence Bottle
text:
{3}, {T}: Put an elixir counter on Essence Bottle.
{T}, Remove all elixir counters from Essence Bottle: You gain 2 life for each elixir counter removed this way.

name: Essence Depleter
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{1}{C}: Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

editions.flavor: When Kozilek emerged at Sea Gate, his brood lineage swarmed to the surface.

name: Essence Drain
text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: Mephidross claims all life within it. What cannot be twisted is absorbed.

"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

"Life's essence is a nectar unlike any I tasted when I lived as a mortal."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

name: Essence Extraction
text: Essence Extraction deals 3 damage to target creature and you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: The "gifted" among the aetherborn can draw the life essence of other living beings into themselves.

name: Essence Feed
text: Target player loses 3 life. You gain 3 life and create three 0/1 colorless Eldrazi Spawn creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: Eldrazi grow wherever something else dies.

name: Essence Filter
text: Destroy all enchantments or all nonwhite enchantments.

editions.flavor:
"Freyalise has cleansed our bodies and minds of the plagues of Kjeldor; all she asks in return is that we keep pure our newly given home in Fyndhorn."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

"Freyalise has cleansed our bodies and minds of the plagues of Kjeldor; all she asks in return is that we keep pure our newly given home in Fyndhorn."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

name: Essence Flare
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor: Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.
Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.
Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.

name: Essence Flux
text: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If it's a Spirit, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: A spirit is both fettered and free—bound in some ways to its previous existence, yet able to transcend much of the corporeal.

name: Essence Fracture
text:
Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor:
"Shaping reality is simply a matter of knowing where to apply pressure."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

name: Essence Harvest
text: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

editions.flavor: Captain Lewenheart uncovered evidence of a demon cult among the clergy. The Skirsdag never gave him a chance to prove his case.

name: Essence Leak
text:
Enchant permanent
As long as enchanted permanent is red or green, it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this permanent unless you pay its mana cost."

editions.flavor:
"We define the boundaries of reality; they don't define us."
—Teferi

name: Essence of the Wild
text: Creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild.

editions.flavor: Wander too far into the wild and it may take you for its own.

name: Essence Scatter
text: Counter target creature spell.

editions.flavor: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.
Dependence on luck is anathema to Kefnet's rigorous studies. Those who hope to escape his maze by chance never succeed.
Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.

"What you attempt to pull from the Æther, I can spread onto the wind."
—Jace Beleren

"What you attempt to pull from the Æther, I can spread onto the wind."
—Jace Beleren

name: Essence Sliver
text: Whenever a Sliver deals damage, its controller gains that much life.

editions.flavor: The slivers would survive, even at the expense of every other creature on Otaria.
The slivers would survive, even at the expense of every other creature on Otaria.

name: Essence Vortex
text: Destroy target creature unless its controller pays life equal to its toughness. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: Masters who sacrifice for servants will receive the gift of loyalty.

name: Essence Warden
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor:
"The more our numbers grow, the more I gain hope that Volrath and his cursed stronghold will one day fall."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"The more our numbers grow, the more I gain hope that Volrath and his cursed stronghold will one day fall."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"The more our numbers grow, the more I gain hope that Volrath and his cursed stronghold will one day fall."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Etched Champion
text: Metalcraft — Etched Champion has protection from all colors as long as you control three or more artifacts.

editions.flavor: Its predecessors were etched with the wisdom of ancients; its own etchings bear warnings of a future fraught with war.
Its predecessors were etched with the wisdom of ancients; its own etchings bear warnings of a future fraught with war.

name: Etched Monstrosity
text:
Etched Monstrosity enters the battlefield with five -1/-1 counters on it.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}, Remove five -1/-1 counters from Etched Monstrosity: Target player draws three cards.

editions.flavor: Now etched only with the scars of phyresis.
Now etched only with the scars of phyresis.

name: Etched Oracle
text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{1}, Remove four +1/+1 counters from Etched Oracle: Target player draws three cards.

name: Etched Oracle Avatar
text: You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay the mana cost for spells that you cast.

editions.flavor: 5DN Participation Avatar

name: Eternal Dominion
text:
Search target opponent's library for an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)

name: Eternal Dragon
text:
Flying
{3}{W}{W}: Return Eternal Dragon from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

name: Eternal Flame
text: Eternal Flame deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of Mountains you control. It deals half X damage, rounded up, to you.

name: Eternal Scourge
text:
You may cast Eternal Scourge from exile.
When Eternal Scourge becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, exile Eternal Scourge.

editions.flavor:
"It has latched onto this place like an infestation. All efforts at eradication have proved futile."
—Yeter, Trostad villager

name: Eternal Thirst
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink and "Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature." (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

name: Eternal Warrior
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance.

editions.flavor: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.
Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

name: Eternal Witness
text: When Eternal Witness enters the battlefield, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Gaea needs no book to record every act.
She remembers every word spoken, from the hero's oath to the baby's cry.
She remembers every word spoken, from the hero's oath to the baby's cry.

text:
Enchant creature
When Eternity Snare enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

name: Eternity Vessel
text:
Eternity Vessel enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it, where X is your life total.
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may have your life total become the number of charge counters on Eternity Vessel.

name: Ethercaste Knight
text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: "We coat ourselves in steel every day. What is etherium but the next logical step?"
"We coat ourselves in steel every day. What is etherium but the next logical step?"

name: Ethereal Ambush
text: Manifest the top two cards of your library. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

editions.flavor: The energies of the Temur lands are readily unleashed upon intruders.

name: Ethereal Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control and has first strike.

editions.flavor: Metal is scarce, smiths are pricey, and plate mail is heavy.

name: Ethereal Champion
text: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.

editions.flavor:
"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles."
—Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba

"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles."
—Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba

name: Ethereal Guidance
text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The call of the Blessed Sleep is not so strong as the call to protect those in need."
—Saint Traft

name: Ethereal Haze
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Imagine a dove flying through smoke. Does the dove injure the smoke? Does the smoke impede the dove?"
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Ethereal Usher
text:
{U}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Transmute {1}{U}{U} ({1}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

name: Ethereal Whiskergill
text:
Flying
Ethereal Whiskergill can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor: Fallowsages debate whether the whiskergill is native to the Dark Meanders or merely dreamstuff made real.

name: Etherium Abomination
text: Unearth {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: It was given life by the etherium of a hundred slain Esperites.

name: Etherium Astrolabe
text:
Flash
{B}, {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Speculation is foolish when the tools of certainty are available."
—Cinna, vedalken consul

name: Etherium-Horn Sorcerer
text:
{1}{U}{R}: Return Etherium-Horn Sorcerer to its owner's hand.
Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

name: Etherium Sculptor
text: Artifact spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

editions.flavor: The greatest masters of the craft abandon tools altogether, shaping metal with hand and mind alone.
The greatest masters of the craft abandon tools altogether, shaping metal with hand and mind alone.
The greatest masters of the craft abandon tools altogether, shaping metal with hand and mind alone.

name: Ethersworn Adjudicator
text:
Flying
{1}{W}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature or enchantment.
{2}{U}: Untap Ethersworn Adjudicator.

editions.flavor: Esper mages devised their weapons to be so devastating that war seemed unnecessary.
Esper mages devised their weapons to be so devastating that war seemed unnecessary.

name: Ethersworn Canonist
text: Each player who has cast a nonartifact spell this turn can't cast additional nonartifact spells.

editions.flavor: "The noble work of our order is to infuse all life on Esper with etherium. Our goal will be reached more rapidly if new life is . . . suppressed."
"The noble work of our order is to infuse all life on Esper with etherium. Our goal will be reached more rapidly if new life is . . . suppressed."

name: Ethersworn Shieldmage
text:
Flash
When Ethersworn Shieldmage enters the battlefield, prevent all damage that would be dealt to artifact creatures this turn.

editions.flavor: "See, children of metal? Already your bodies are rejecting harm. Continue on our path, and perfection will be yours."

name: Ether Well
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library. If that creature is red, you may put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead.

editions.flavor: "Whoa—my tail will never fit through that hole!"

name: Etherwrought Page
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• You gain 2 life.
• Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
• Each opponent loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: An unbound page is a riddle, free of cover and of context, a favorite token of the hegemon.

name: Eunuchs' Intrigues
text: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Other creatures he or she controls can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

name: Eureka
text: Starting with you, each player may put a permanent card from his or her hand onto the battlefield. Repeat this process until no one puts a card onto the battlefield.

name: Evacuation
text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: The first step of every exodus is from the blood and the fire onto the trail.
Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?

"How many people can you save in that thing?"
"All of them," replied the mage with a smile.

"Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

"Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

name: Evanescent Intellect
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{U}, {T}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard."

editions.flavor: The mind is a vessel that may be emptied like any other.

name: Evangelize
text:
Buyback {2}{W}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W}{W} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls.

name: Evangel of Heliod
text: When Evangel of Heliod enters the battlefield, create a number of 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens equal to your devotion to white. (Each {W} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to white.)

name: Evaporate
text: Evaporate deals 1 damage to each white and/or blue creature.

editions.flavor:
"The body is a temple with a foundation of sand."
—Autumn Willow

name: Evasive Action
text: Domain — Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.flavor: Effective use of terrain is a lesson good commanders learn quickly.

editions.flavor: Effective use of terrain is a lesson good commanders learn quickly.

name: Even the Odds
text:
Cast Even the Odds only if you control fewer creatures than each opponent.
Create three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

editions.flavor:
"They who fall singing the battle hymn of Benalia go not unavenged."
—Adom Capashen, Benalish commander

name: Ever After
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. Each of those creatures is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types. Put Ever After on the bottom of its owner's library.

name: Everbark Shaman
text: {T}, Exile a Treefolk card from your graveyard: Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: "May you rise again, from seed to sapling to sentience."

Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

text:
Multikicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Everflowing Chalice enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each time it was kicked.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Everflowing Chalice.

text:
Everglades enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {C}{B} to your mana pool.

text:
You may choose not to untap Everglove Courier during your untap step.
{2}{G}, {T}: Target Elf creature gets +2/+2 and has trample for as long as Everglove Courier remains tapped.

name: Everlasting Torment
text:
Players can't gain life.
Damage can't be prevented.
All damage is dealt as though its source had wither. (A source with wither deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

text:

text:

Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

text:
Flying
Evershrike gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
{X}{W/B}{W/B}: Return Evershrike from your graveyard to the battlefield. You may put an Aura card with converted mana cost X or less from your hand onto the battlefield attached to it. If you don't, exile Evershrike.

name: Every Hope Shall Vanish
text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a nonland card from each of those hands. Those players discard those cards.

editions.flavor: "Oh, I think I will get away with this."

name: Every Last Vestige Shall Rot
text: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay {X}. If you do, put each nonland permanent target player controls with converted mana cost X or less on the bottom of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: "May bloodberries grow from your remains."

name: Evil Comes to Fruition
text: When you set this scheme in motion, create seven 0/1 green Plant creature tokens. If you control ten or more lands, create seven 3/3 green Elemental creature tokens instead.

editions.flavor: "The plants justify the means."

name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.

editions.flavor: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.

name: Evil Eye of Urborg
text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.
Whenever Evil Eye of Urborg becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.

editions.flavor: "Edahlis, what is that thing? We should have stayed in Yavimaya . . . ." —Aznaph, greenseeker

name: Evil Presence
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

editions.flavor:
"The Accorders would lament the transformation of their cherished lands, had they lived to see it."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Evil Presents
text: Put a creature card from your hand into play under target opponent's control. That creature attacks each turn if able... and always attacks its controller.

editions.flavor: 'Tis better to give than to receive.

name: Evil Twin
text: You may have Evil Twin enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it gains "{U}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with the same name as this creature."

editions.flavor: You can always tell the evil one by the dagger he's sticking in you.
You can always tell the evil one by the dagger he's sticking in you.

name: Evincar's Justice
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Evincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

name: Eviscerator
text:
Protection from white
When Eviscerator enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

editions.flavor: It roamed the time bubble like a captured animal. Kerrick knew he must soon find a way to unleash it on Tolaria or destroy it.
